Description: Two fragments of linen, perhaps used in a burial, without woven or dyed decoration, but with a painted design. On a white pigment ground a brown ring (dia. 19.5cm) enclosing a six-petalled blue flower with a red centre. Black outlines. Ring and flower look as though they were drawn with a compass. The two fragments fit together to form an almost complete rectangle, torn ends, plain selvedge at one side, the other side torn and folded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), South Rampart Street level 3B
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
